intro: Christella normalis, commonly known as the common christella, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
